original_solution_mapping.L1: Mark has 60% 12 sided dice, so 60/100 * 10 dice in his bag = <<60/100*10=6>>6 12 sided dice.
original_solution_mapping.L2: James has 75% 12 sided dice, so 75/100 * 8 dice in his bag = <<75/100*8=6>>6 12 sided dice.
original_solution_mapping.L3: They will need to purchase 14 dice - 6 dice - 6 dice = <<14-6-6=2>>2 dice.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6657.
    Returns: the number of dice the boys need to buy.
    """
    # L1
    mark_percentage_12_sided = Fraction(60, 100) # 60% of them are 12 sided
    mark_total_dice = 10 # Mark has a bag of 10 dice
    mark_12_sided_dice = mark_percentage_12_sided * mark_total_dice

    # L2
    james_percentage_12_sided = Fraction(75, 100) # 75% of them are 12 sided
    james_total_dice = 8 # James has a bag of 8 dice
    james_12_sided_dice = james_percentage_12_sided * james_total_dice

    # L3
    total_dice_needed = 14 # total of 14 dice
    dice_to_buy = total_dice_needed - mark_12_sided_dice - james_12_sided_dice

    # FA
    answer = dice_to_buy
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Mark has 60% 12 sided dice, so {mark_percentage_12_sided} * {mark_total_dice} = <<{mark_percentage_12_sided}*{mark_total_dice}={mark_12_sided_dice}>>{mark_12_sided_dice} 12 sided dice.
James has 75% 12 sided dice, so {james_percentage_12_sided} * {james_total_dice} = <<{james_percentage_12_sided}*{james_total_dice}={james_12_sided_dice}>>{james_12_sided_dice} 12 sided dice.

They will need to purchase {total_dice_needed} dice - {mark_12_sided_dice} dice - {james_12_sided_dice} dice = <<{total_dice_needed}-{mark_12_sided_dice}-{james_12_sided_dice}={dice_to_buy}>>{dice_to_buy} dice.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Mark has 60% 12 sided dice, so 60/100 * 10 = <<60/100*10=6>>6 12 sided dice.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: James has 75% 12 sided dice, so 75/100 * 10 = <<75/100*10=15/2>>15/2 12 sided dice.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: They will need to purchase 14 dice - 6 dice - 15/2 dice = <<14-6-15/2=1/2>>1/2 dice.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'mark_total_dice' (10) was used instead of 'james_total_dice' (8).
